definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
cigarette or pipe tobacco/CL:根[gen1]/smoke/mist/vapour/CL:縷|缕[lu:3]/tobacco plant/(of the eyes) to be irritated by smoke

sentences.english: He took a pack of cigarettes from his shirt pocket .
sentences.chinese: 他从衬衣口袋里取出一包纸烟。

sentences.english: He the oblique line ground start connecting to burn the second cigarette to my Chou's one eye.
sentences.chinese: 他斜线地向我瞅一眼，开始接烧第二支纸烟。

sentences.english: He rolled some tobacco and made a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 他把烟丝裹起来，卷成一根纸烟。

sentences.english: I used to work at a tobacconist's, and I found it quite interesting.
sentences.chinese: 从前我在一家纸烟店工作，我对那里的工作很感兴趣。

sentences.english: You, know. flapjack and a cigarette?
What we want is a pack of cigarettes and a bit of skirt in a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 我们想要的是一包纸烟和一个出租车里的女人。

sentences.english: Then Robert Strickland struck a match and lit a cigarette.
sentences.chinese: 思特里克兰德划了根火柴，点着了一支纸烟。

sentences.english: The Yi pays greater half with the hand cigarette to cast away a cigarette ash basin on desk inside.
sentences.chinese: 伊随手将大半支纸烟丢在书桌上的烟灰盆里。
